tool.name: RIAssigner init from comment
tool.description: Assign different retention indices from unstructured comment metadata

configfiles.configfile: from RIAssigner.data import PandasData, MatchMSData #if $input.ext in ["csv", "tsv", "parquet"] query = PandasData('${input}', '${input.ext}', rt_unit="seconds") #else query = MatchMSData('${input}', '${input.ext}', rt_unit="seconds") #end if query.init_ri_from_comment('${format}') query.write('results.${input.ext}')

param.name: input
param.label: Input File
param.help: File with 'comment' metadata in which to assign the selected retention index type from 'comment' to 'retention_index'.

param.name: format
param.label: GC column type
param.help: Type of gas chromatographic column for which to set the retention index value

tool.help: This tool can be used to assign retention indices (RI) from the comment field in csv, tsv, parquet, or msp files. The tool will read RI from the comment field and assign them to the RI field. The type of gas chromatographic column for which to set the retention index value can be selected.
